bibl.title: In the matter of the Habeas Corpus of "Till" v. Milton Willerford. Petition.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: District Court of the United States for the District of Nebraska

div1.p: United States District Court, District of Nebraska
The United States vs. In matter of Habeas Corpus of "Till"
Silias Robbnis Benji. S. Baker U.S Attorney
In the United States District Court in and in the District of Beranska In Re. Till Petition
Filed, Oct 22 1890 Elnor S. Dundy Jr. Clerk
The United States of America, District of Nebraska

To Honorable Judge of the District Court of the United States for the District of Nebraska: Your peitioner, M.O. Ricketts, a citizen of the State of Nebraska, on behalf of "Till" a colored boy of the age of about 18 years respectfully represents unto your Honor that the said Till is now unlawfully and wrongfully restrained of his liberty and held as a slave by Milton Willerford of and at Fillmore County in the State of Nebraska in violation of the Thriteenth Amendment to the constitution of the United States of America; that the said Milton Willerford clairms to have purchased the said TIill either in Kentucky or Missouri where he formerly lived and brought the said boy Till to Fillmore County, Nebraska, some seven or eight years ago, clairming then to be the owner of him as his slave, and ever since then he has claimed to own the said boy Till as as his slave at said Fillmore County, and during all this time has treated him cruelly and in an inhumane manner, depriving him of all liberty and the ordinary comforts of life. And your petitioner shows that the said Till is not held under or by virtue of any process of any court of the United States or of any state, and that he is not held for any crime comitted in violation of any law of the United States or of any state.

And your petitioner futher shows that the said Till, by reason of his being long held in slavery by the said Milton Willerford and the treatment he has recieved, is unable to read or write, or to fully understand his situation and condition, and by reason thereof, this petition is presented in his behalf by your peititoner M. O. Ricketts, aforesaid.

Wherefore, your petitioner prays that your Honor issue the Writ of Habeas Corpus directing and commanding the Marshall of said district to bring the body of the said "Till" before your Honor and to summon the said Milton Willerford to appear and state the cause of his detaining the said "Till" and that the said "Till" may be discharged from the custody of the said Milton Willerford and set free to go where he will and for full relief in the premises.
State of Nebraska, Douglas County. } ss.
M. O. Ricketts being first duly sworn, on oath, says he has read the above and foregoing peititon and knows the contents thereof, and the same are true as he believes.
Subscribed in my presence and sworn to before me
